result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole L Tasker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: from Defendant re: post conviction relief

Reserve Judge Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV:  
[MK] cases #15CF134 & #15CF148 called at 8:56am. 
Defendant Nicole L Tasker in court, in custody, with Attorney Sydne French.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing arguments are given by DA Happ, by Attorney French.
Ms. Tasker makes a statement.

On Case #15CF134 the Court sentences Ms. Tasker to 3 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  18 months.  This sentence is to commence forthwith
The Court finds that Ms. Tasker is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Ms. Tasker Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 430 days credit for time already served. 
-----------------------------------------

On Case #15CF148 the Court sentences Ms. Tasker to  3 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 18 months.  This sentence is consecutive to Case #15CF134.
The Court finds that Ms. Tasker is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Ms. Tasker Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 0 days credit for time already served.


The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision on both cases:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent 
--to submit to random drug and alcohol testing
--to maintain employment and/or education programming unless in full-time treatment  
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as approved by the Agent
--to pay the balance due on court-ordered financial obligations 

recess 9:39am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 13, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 9, 2017 at 09:00 am.
with cover letter covering cases 15CF134 and 15CF148.
Request denied for the same reasons previously provided cc: all - RRK
Request to reinstate huber is denied

records.addlTxt:
Cases 15CF134 & 15CF148 called together at 1:32 pm [Clerk SH] (Cases were scheduled for STC)
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Nicole L Tasker in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO BOTH CASES: Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Ms. Tasker waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Arraignment.
State files information; Arraignment:--service of Information admitted, reading waived--maximum penalties recited

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1-15CF134 & Count #1-15CF148; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea,  finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

On Count #1-15CF134 & Count#1-15CF148, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--serve 8 months in Jefferson County Jail (15CF134), with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence forthwith
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random drug and/or alcohol screening
--To maintain employment and/or education program unless invloved in full time treatment, per Agent
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--No contact with Allison Peot, Jonathan Rusch, Benjamin Harmon or Keith Lueloff
--No presence at the Hilltop Motel, Jefferson
--100 hours of community service designed to educate youth and the public about the dangers of opiates
--To pay costs of $268 (15CF134)
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge (15CF134)
--To pay costs of $268 (15CF148)
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge (15CF148)
--To pay $25 drug testing fee (15CF148)
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--No contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent

No suspension of driving privileges
Days credit for time already served: 3 days-15CF134
Days credit for time already served: 0 days-15CF148
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Recess: 2:31 pm

[Reserve Judge Sarah OBrien presiding for Branch IV]
Cases 15CF134 and 15CF148 called together  at 11:00am [mo]
Defendant Nicole L Tasker in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 15CF148(Initial Appearance occurs):

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5000   Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of any drug paraphernalia


As to both cases:
Atty. Rhiel requests that both cases track together and requests they be set for PTC and STC
recess : 11:05am

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 8/19/15 at 3:20pm   (2) Status Conference on 8/21/15 at 1:15pm
Status conference on July 10, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.

[MK] case called at 1:25pm. 
Defendant Nicole L. Tasker appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Ms. Tasker verifies that the date of birth and address on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $10,000  signature bond, with conditions:
--no contact with Jonathan Rusch, Allison Peot
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia, to include needles, without a prescription
--booking at Jefferson County Sheriff's Office today  
recess 1:31pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 6/10/15 at 10:00am.  (2) Status Conference on July 10th at 11:00am  (JA- please note in comments that case is at Prelim stage)
